page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The major part of the area surveyed by our school comprises the village of Little Cornard, although the north-west corner of the area encompasses part of the neighbouring village of Great Cornard.The River Stour runs through the south west corner of the area.The Stour valley has been designated an area of outstanding natural beauty.At the boundary of the two villages is a nature conservation area known as Cornard Mere. There is a single track railway line which runs from Sudbury to Marks Tey - the nearest station being at Sudbury (two miles).There is a regular bus service from Bury St. Edmunds to Colchester.Buses stop on the Bures Road in both Little and Great Cornard.
